alert.note: Alert for City of Emporia (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 9:47PM EST until December 18 at 2:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northeast North Carolina, including the following county, Northampton and Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, Amelia, Brunswick, Chesterfield, City of Emporia, Dinwiddie, Greensville, Nottoway, Prince George, Southampton and Sussex. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 947 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dinwiddie, Emporia, Blackstone, Lawrenceville, Garysburg, McKenney, Brodnax, Purdy, Dahlia, Mannboro, Amelia Courthouse, Moseley, Brunswick, Gaston, Jarratt, Seaboard, Alberta, Stony Creek, Dewitt and Radium. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
